lead_paragraph: An arbitrator ruled that Kathleen Elvin, the former principal of John Dewey High School, should be reinstated after she was accused of improperly giving students credit for courses in which they received no instruction. The arbitrator said that an audit later conducted by the Education Department, which found that the courses met the department's guidelines, effectively exonerated her.

headline.main: Ruling to Dismiss Charges Against Principal

snippet: An arbitrator ruled that Kathleen Elvin, the former principal of John Dewey High School, should be reinstated after she was accused of improperly giving students credit for courses in which they received no instruction. The arbitrator said that an audit later conducted by the Education Department, which found that the courses met the department's guidelines, effectively exonerated her.
